data.title: Coptic Encyclopedia Volume VII (Q-Z)
data.meta_description: Coptic Encyclopedia Volume VII (Q-Z) - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. The document summarizes the history of Qasr Ibrim, an ancient fortified settlement in Lower Nubia along the Nile River. It was first occupied in the Egyptian New Kingdom and was an important religious center for the Meroites and Nobatae kingdoms. In the 6th century, a church was established at the site, making it one of the earliest Christian sites in Nubia. Over subsequent centuries, Qasr Ibrim was occupied by various powers and saw the construction of a cathedral and secular buildings. It remained important through the medieval period until being abandoned in the early 19th century after changing hands between various groups. Archaeological excavations since 1963 have uncovered important historical artifacts.
